results.title: Spellblade
results.summary: You fuse steel and spell—decisive force guided by arcane intuition.
results.lore: Spellblades don’t choose between might and mystery. They treat magic like a second grip on the hilt: a way to cut through impossible angles, to turn raw intent into something elegant and final.
results.growthQuest: Choose when to channel and when to commit steel.
results.signatureItem: Runic Longsword of the Split Current
results.battleHabit: Break the line with a weave-step strike.
traits: You act fast when you feel a clear opening.
You trust experimentation as much as tradition.
You prefer solutions that end the problem, not manage it.

results.title: Paladin
results.summary: You stand as a vow made visible—protection powered by purpose.
results.lore: Paladins are not simply defenders. They are promises with shoulders. They hold the line not because it’s safe, but because someone must decide that the innocent will not be priced out of peace.
results.growthQuest: Trust allies to carry shared responsibility.
results.battleHabit: Anchor first, then force a decisive counter.
traits: You take responsibility without asking for credit.
You endure longer than most people expect.
You protect what matters, even when it costs you.

results.title: Assassin
results.summary: You move like a rumor—speed and cunning in perfect agreement.
results.lore: Assassins don’t chase chaos. They remove it. A clean cut, a silent exit, an outcome that looks like fate to everyone who wasn’t watching closely enough.
results.growthQuest: Coordinate earlier instead of solving alone.
results.battleHabit: Create one clean opening and exit instantly.
traits: You can be calm while moving fast.

results.title: Bard
results.summary: You turn momentum into music—magic amplified by leadership and timing.
results.lore: Bards are not ‘just charming.’ They’re strategic storytellers who can change a room’s gravity. They can make fear lighter, make courage contagious, and make a team feel like a single instrument.
results.growthQuest: Protect your own rhythm while lifting others.
traits: You lift morale without forcing it.

results.title: Monk
results.summary: You are discipline in motion—speed controlled by intent.
results.lore: Monks don’t waste movement. They don’t waste emotion either. Their power is in restraint: striking only when the moment is true, leaving no extra damage behind them.
results.growthQuest: Convert restraint into decisive finishing windows.
results.battleHabit: Counter at the exact edge of range.
traits: You prefer clean execution to drama.
You move fast, but not impulsively.

results.title: Druid
results.summary: You heal and change—faith guided by wild magic and patient wisdom.
results.lore: Druids don’t control life—they cooperate with it. They read the weather of people, the seasons of a team, and they know when to restore and when to transform.
results.battleHabit: Shift from restoration to control on one cue.
traits: You care deeply, but you’re not naïve.
You’re drawn to patterns bigger than the moment.
You can restore strength without demanding dependence.

results.title: Artificer
results.summary: You turn ideas into weapons—tactics fused with arcane engineering.
results.lore: Artificers don’t wait for miracles. They manufacture them. A careful plan, a clever tool, an elegant constraint—then suddenly the impossible becomes repeatable.
results.growthQuest: Ship practical answers faster in chaos.
results.battleHabit: Win by changing the rules of the room.
traits: You build systems, not just solutions.
You win by making problems smaller.

results.title: Captain
results.summary: You lead from the front—protection shaped into coordination.
results.lore: Captains aren’t loud by default. They’re steady by design. They keep people alive by turning panic into sequence: who moves, who holds, who follows, and when.
results.risk: Assuming every decision must be yours
results.battleHabit: Assign lanes before the clash lands.
traits: You naturally assign roles and stabilize chaos.
You make teams feel safer and sharper.

results.title: Berserker
results.summary: You are impact—when you commit, the world must respond.
results.lore: Berserkers aren’t mindless. They’re decisive. They know the cost of hesitation, so they choose the moment, and they spend everything on it.
results.growthQuest: Pace your power across longer engagements.
traits: You can tolerate risk when it ends uncertainty.
You become most alive under pressure.

results.title: Guardian
results.summary: You are the shield—calm endurance that others rely on.
results.lore: Guardians don’t chase glory. They prevent tragedy. They stand where the damage lands, and their strength is measured in the number of people who make it home.
results.risk: Carrying damage that should be shared
results.growthQuest: Turn durability into coordinated team confidence.
results.battleHabit: Absorb pressure to buy team execution time.

results.title: Ranger
results.summary: You are the first step—speed, awareness, and clean decisions.
results.lore: Rangers don’t look for fair fights. They look for true routes: the line that avoids waste, the movement that turns danger into distance, the shot that ends the chase.
results.growthQuest: Surface information sooner for team tempo.
traits: You prefer precision over brute force.

results.title: Tactician
results.summary: You are control—winning by turning chaos into sequence.
results.lore: Tacticians don’t need the strongest sword. They need the right moment. They build advantage quietly until the outcome feels inevitable.
results.growthQuest: Trust informed instinct when plans fracture.

results.title: Sorcerer
results.summary: You are possibility—magic, curiosity, and fearless experimentation.
results.lore: Sorcerers treat reality like it’s negotiable. They reach for the strange option first, not to be different, but because they can feel hidden doors in the air.

results.title: Cleric
results.summary: You are restoration—purpose that makes people stronger than pain.
results.lore: Clerics don’t just heal wounds. They mend morale. They remind people what they’re fighting for, and they turn survival into something worth surviving for.
results.growthQuest: Protect your own reserves while sustaining others.
results.battleHabit: Reset the team before pushing momentum.

results.title: Rogue
results.summary: You are leverage—quiet advantage, sharp timing, and clean escapes.
results.lore: Rogues don’t fight the whole problem. They steal the problem’s power, then walk away. Their wins look like luck to people who don’t know where to look.
traits: You understand incentives and pressure points.

results.title: Warlord
results.summary: You are direction—your presence organizes the fight.
results.lore: Warlords don’t need to be the strongest. They make everyone stronger. They turn individual talent into coordinated force, and chaos into a plan people can trust.
results.battleHabit: Issue one clear call and press advantage.
traits: You make decisions when others hesitate.

results.title: Wayfarer
results.summary: You carry sparks from many paths, but no single banner claims you yet.
results.lore: Wayfarers are in-between by design. You adapt, test, and learn before committing to one doctrine. This result should be rare and usually signals a broad, mixed profile rather than a fixed combat identity.
results.growthQuest: Pick one edge to sharpen while keeping your range.
results.battleHabit: Probe first, then commit where resistance bends.
traits: You stay flexible when situations change quickly.
You are still calibrating what role fits you best.
You value optionality over strict specialization.
